intro: Erodium obtusiplicatum, commonly known as broad-leaved bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Leguminosae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its hairy stems and ovate, toothed leaves. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. Its fruit is a legume pod that splits open to release small, kidney-shaped seeds. Erodium obtusiplicatum is often found in grasslands and disturbed soils, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
